Portal.Title: Settings for the entire portal
Portal.Intro: These settings apply to all content and all apps within this portal.

Templates.Title: Manage Templates
Templates.InfoHideAdvanced: Improve the user experience for the content-editor by hiding advanced features from him. If your portal contains a security role called “2sxc designers”, then non-members will not see buttons like Edit Template or Manage Templates. How-To documented here.

unused.Title: Get content as if it were data for your template or JavaScript
unused.Intro: Use the query designer to create complex queries. They can be used in normal templates (Token/Razor) or in JavaScript. Or you can create your custom JSON-WebAPI which is only for JavaScript - for example to save something, retrieve a file or perform a query too complex for the designer. Read more about coding data pipelines and about using the data in JavaScript with jQuery, AngularJS and more.

Visual.Title: Visual Data Query
Visual.Intro: Use the Visual Query Designer (Pipeline-Designer) to create queries to data from 2sxc, SQL, RSS and more.

WebApi.Title: WebApi for this App
WebApi.Intro: Create a WebApi within minutes by placing the source code in the folder called API and inheriting the correct interface. Try it out by creating one automatically and pressing here. Read more about the WebApi or the C# data editing API.
WebApi.ListTitle: The following list shows the .cs files in the App-API folder:
WebApi.QuickStart: For a quick start, we recommend that you install the WebApi demo-app. It contains some WebAPI controllers with various actions and some example views to use these controllers. Download WebApi demos in the App-Catalog or read more about it in help

ImportExport.Title: Import Templates and Content into this App/Content
ImportExport.Intro: This import will add Content-Types, Templates and Content-Items to the current Content or App.
ImportExport.Alternatives:
• If you want to import a new App, go to App-Management
  • If you want to import Tables/Lists of content-items, go to the tab Content / Data
  • To export an the entire Content (to migrate / duplicate this site) or to export an App, go to App-Management
  • To exports lists (tables) of Content-Items please go to the tab Content / Data
ImportExport.FurtherHelp: For further help visit 2sxc Help.

Import.Title: Import a content export (.zip) or a partial export (.xml)
Import.Explanation: This import will add Content-Types, Templates and Content-Items to the current Content or App.

Export.Title: Partial Export of Content Types, Template Configuration and Content
Export.Intro: This is an advanced export feature to export parts of this Content / App. It will create an XML-file for you which you can import into another site or App
Export.FurtherHelp: For further help visit 2sxc Help.

Portal.Title: Virtual Database (VDB)
Portal.Rename: Note to 2tk - rename is not necessary any more, don't implement!

Language.Title: Languages / Cultures
Language.Intro: Manage the enabled / disable languages for this Zone (this portal)

AppConfig.Title: App Configuration
AppConfig.Intro: Configure the App and special App-settings here.

Settings.Title: App Settings
Settings.Intro: Settings are configurations used by the app - like SQL-connection strings, default "items-to-show" numbers and things like that. They can also be multi-language, so that a setting (like default RSS-Feed) could be different in each language.

Resources.Title: App Resources
Resources.Intro: Resources are used for labels and things like that in the App. They are usually needed to create multi-lingual views and such, and should not be used for App-Settings.

ReplaceContent.Title: Replace Content Item
ReplaceContent.Intro: By replacing a content-item you can make a other content appear in the slot of the original content.
